user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_get_free:
```c
size_t
MHD_pool_get_free (struct MemoryPool *pool)
{
  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->pos == ROUND_TO_ALIGN (pool->pos));
#ifdef MHD_ASAN_POISON_ACTIVE
  if ((pool->end - pool->pos) <= _MHD_RED_ZONE_SIZE)
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_ASAN_POISON_ACTIVE */
  return (pool->end - pool->pos) - _MHD_RED_ZONE_SIZE;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return (pool->end - pool->pos) - _MHD_RED_ZONE_SIZE;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The return statement is reachable: when MHD_ASAN_POISON_ACTIVE is not defined the function always reaches and executes this return; when MHD_ASAN_POISON_ACTIVE is defined it is reached for the case (pool->end - pool->pos) > _MHD_RED_ZONE_SIZE (the if only returns early when the difference is <= _MHD_RED_ZONE_SIZE). The mhd_assert checks do not make this statement statically unreachable. Therefore the code does not contain unreachable code.
